Lead with Value: Reinvent Business Capabilities - Engage Customers

  • Business Case

As-is

GenAI
Powered

Analyse and Strategize
Enable
Execute
Service

Customer Identification

Identify potential customers through manual research, cold calls & market research data

Customer Awareness

Make customer aware through cold calling,sales materials and adhoc visits.

Customer Onboarding

Onboard customer through a series of manual steps,including paperwork and educational meetings

Portfolio and Negotiation

Manual negotiation generically applied across all customers based on sales rep skill set and knowledge

Order Capture

Either EDI or manual entry methods based on opinion

Order Confirmation

Might require manual cross-referencing and communication. i.e phone call, F2F discussion

Credit and Invoice Management

System or manual invoice creation with no tracking of credit and other safeguards

Order Delivery

Requires manual coordination with logistics,warehouse,delivery team

Sell-out Activation

Guidelines checked and executed manually

Customer Service

Manual customer service with restrictions on capacity,time-bound,templated answer

Loyalty and Value Added Service

Manged through a standard set of offerings no personalisation

Responsible AI: In Action

  • Industry and AI Risks

1

Growth Spaces Identified

2

Customer Journey

Level of Concern

#1 Risk - Confidentiality and Security: due to Handling Sensitive Data such as Formula, Recipe, Strategy

#2 Risk - Bias and Harm: Biased Data could Lead to Discriminatory Practices and Set the Trajectory for the Entire Customer Journey

#3 Risk - Unreliable Output: can Result from Data that is Outdated, Incomplete or Incorrectly Processed by AI Algorithms

#1 Risk - Confidentiality and Security: AI Expose Sensitive Customer Data, Breaching Confidentiality

#2 Risk - Bias and Harm: Might Propagate Biases, Leading to Unfair / Harmful Customer Treatment

#3 Risk - Liability and Compliance: Legal Challenges if AI Violates Regulatory Requirements or Ethical Standards

#1 Risk - Confidentiality and Security: Breaches in Financial or Customer Data

#2 Risk - Unreliable Outputs: Outdated or Incorrect Data Processed by Algorithms

#3 Risk - Bias and Harm: Unfair or Exclusions Customary Offers

#1 Risk - Confidentiality and Security: Risk Unauthorised Access or Misuse of Customer Data during Processing

#2 Risk - Unreliable Output: Generate Incorrect or Inconsistent Order Confirmations

#3 Risk - Liability and Compliance: AI Generated Errors in Order Confirmation Leading to Non-Complaince

#1 Risk - Unreliable Output: Propose Inefficient or Impractical Delivery Routes, Affecting Service Quality

#2 Risk - Sustainability: Overlook Environmental Impact, Leading to Unsustainable Practices

#3 Risk - Liability and Compliance: Inaccurate or Unsafe AI-recommended Routes could Result in Regulatory Repercussions

#1 Risk - Unreliable Output: Generate Inappropriate or Irrelevant Visual Content

#2 Risk - Liability and Compliance: Violating Copyright or Other Legal Standards due to AI-generated Imagery

#3 Risk - Sustainability: Digital Waste or Unsustainable Energy Consumption

#1 Risk - Confidentiality and Security: Mishandle Personal Data, Leading to Privacy Breaches in Personalized Services

#2 Risk - Liability and Compliance: AI Suggestion Might Violate Privacy Laws, Discriminates, or Fails to Meet Transparency Standards

#3 Risk - Bias and Harm: Perpetuate Biases, Resulting in Discriminatory or Harmful Customer Experiences

Steps

Responsible AI: AI Risks for Consumer Goods

  • AI Risks Dimensions
  • Value Chain

Bias and Harm

Application of Existing Biases that Leads to Under-representation, Stereotypes, Unethical or Societal Bias in Product Design, Recommendation and Marketing Tactics

Promoting Unhealthy Products and Consumer

Liability and Compliance

Copyright Infringement in AI-generated Content/ Services and Product Designs

Non-compliance with Existing and Changing Regulations for Consumer Data Privacy, and Consumer Protection and Security

Unreliable Outputs

Copyright Infringement in AI-generated Content/ Services and Product Designs

Non-compliance with Existing and Changing Regulations for Consumer Data Privacy, and Consumer Protection and Security

Confidentiality and Security

Leaking of Sensitive Customer/Consumer Data (such as Financial Transactions) and Highly Confidential Formula, Recipes..

Unwanted Revealing of Go-to-market (esp. Pricing) Strategies

Sustainability

Increased Energy Consumption and Carbon Emissions to esp. When Every Hyper-personalized Consumer Touchpoint is Generated by AI

Promotion of Non-ethical, Non-sustainable Sourcing

Workforce Transition

Job Displacement/ Relocation with Social Distress; especially at Back-office Operations, Salesforce

Restructure Workforce (Replace, Reskill, Upskill, etc.) in a Human-centric and Empathic Way Without Creating Opposition Movement of the “Old” Against the “New”

Innovate and Grow

Engage Consumers

Engage Customers

Supply

Manufacturing

Care (ESG)

Shared Services and Corporate

Data Privacy and Security

A Pervasive Risk across all Steps: The Collection, Storage, and Processing of Large Volumes of Consumers and Operational Data by AI Systems Raise Significant Privacy and Security Concerns; Including IT Processes which can be Vulnerable to Cyber Attacks

Data Bias

AI Incorporates Biases from Consumer Data, Leading to Products Innovation that dont Cater to Diverse Consumers Needs; Wrong Targeting Marketing Campaigns; Unfair Pricing Strategies or Promoting Unhealthy Products/ Behaviors

Unreliable Forecast/Errors

Unreliable Data Inputs, Leading to Inaccuracies: for Supply Chain it can be Overstocking or Stock-outs or Production Inefficiency in Manufacturing

Confidential Information:

IP Exposure: Risk that IP, Strategy, Recipe, Formulation could be Exposed through Security Breaches or AI’s Interactions with External Data and Systems

Copyright Compliance:

Risk of Copyright Infringement on Marketing Content Generated by AI

Unreliable Information:

False/ Unreliable Product Information/ Claims

Unreliable Outcomes:

Inadequacy of AI Generated Responses in Customer Service: Chat-bots Might Provide Inaccurate, Answers to Customer Inquiries, Especially in Complex or Nuanced Situations

Bias:

Vendor Selection: AI Algorithms to Develop or Perpetuate Biases in Selection Vendors or Suppliers such as Lack of Diversity and Potentially Unfair Practices or Suggest Non-ethical, On-sustainable Sourcing

Workforce Collaboration:

Could Lead to Job Displacement, Especially in Production/ Operation. They also get Impacted by Safety Risks with AI-controlled Experience

Sustainability Dilemma:

Environmental Impact: AI’s Large Carbon Footprint due to Heavy Computational Requirements can Directly Conflict with Environmental Sustainability Goals

Bias/Error and Confidentiality

Bias in HR:
Recruitment/ Performance Evaluation, could Inadvertently Reinforce Biases.
Financial Errors:
If based on Flawed Data, Leading to Poor Financial Planning and Decision-making

Ecosystem Partners, Contractors

Lower Risk: Limited Business Disruption

Moderate Financial or Operational Consequences

Major Disruptions with Significant Consequences
